statement.p: Write the equation ~y=x^2-12x+24~ in vertex form.
Write the equation ~y=3x^2+12x+4~ in vertex form.

solution.p: The vertex is (15,-72). We find the y-intercept by setting x=0: y=2(\alert{0}-15)^2-72=378 The y-intercept is (0, 378). We find the x-intercepts by setting y=0: 2(x-15)^2-72 \amp = \alert{0} (x-15)^2 \amp = 36 x \amp = \pm 6+15 The x-intercepts are (9,0) and (21,0). We plot these three points and sketch the parabola through them.

subsection.title: 3. Solve an equation for a parameter

statement.p: The point (6,2) lies on the graph of ~y=a(x-4)^2+1.~ Solve for a.

solution.p: Substitute 6 for x and 2 for y, then solve for a. \alert{2} \amp = a(\alert{6}-4)^2+1 2 \amp = a(4) + 1 1 \amp = 4a The solution is a = \dfrac{1}{4}.

statement.p: The point (-2,11) lies on the graph of ~y=x^2+bx-3.~ Solve for b.

solution.p: Substitute -2 for x and 11 for y, then solve for b. (\alert{-2})^2 +b(\alert{-2}) -3 \amp = 11 4-2b-3 \amp = 11 -2b \amp = 10 The solution is b = -5.
